Literature & Books.name: Fable & Verse: A Literary Primer
Literature & Books.description: Test your knowledge of classic tales and poetic forms with this introductory quiz. From Aesop's fables to Lewis Carroll's whimsical verse, see how well you know the foundations of literature.

questions.text: Which of these is not one of Aesop's fables?
questions.hint: This title sounds like a modern invention, not a classic fable.

questions.text: In the novel 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer' what is the name of Tom's sweetheart?
questions.hint: Her name is a classic, feminine one, and she’s a key figure in Tom’s youthful adventures.

questions.text: If you are watching a Shavian play, who is the author?
questions.hint: This playwright is known for works like 'Pygmalion' and sharp social commentary.

questions.text: Who wrote 'A Tale of Two Cities'?
questions.hint: This author is famous for his vivid depictions of the French Revolution.

Literature & Books.name: Echoes of the Page: Literary Adaptations
Literature & Books.description: Explore the intersection of literature and film with this quiz. Discover the stories behind beloved movies and test your knowledge of the authors who inspired them.

questions.text: The film 'Stand By Me' is based on a novel by what author?
questions.hint: This author is famous for horror novels like 'Carrie' and 'The Shining.'

questions.text: What literary work is the source of the quote 'Abandon every hope, all you who enter here'?
questions.hint: This quote appears at the gates of Hell in a medieval Italian epic.

questions.text: In the novel 'Around the World in 80 Days' Phileas Fogg's faithful valet is named what?
questions.hint: His name suggests a versatile, all-purpose servant, fitting for a global adventure.
